    I am currently a Ph.D. student enrolled in the Fall 2023 semester in the Department of Electrical and Electronic Engineering at The University of Hong Kong (HKU). Prior to joining HKU, I pursued my Master‚Äôs (MS) degree in the Department of Automation and Shenzhen International Graduate School at Tsinghua University (THU), specializing in big data engineering and exploring the field of computer vision for a duration of three years. I also hold a Bachelor‚Äôs (BS) degree in Electronic and Information Engineering from the School of Electronic and Optical Engineering at Nanjing University of Science and Technology (NJUST).

    I am fortunate to be under the guidance of Dr. Yifan (Evan) Peng from the WeLightLab@HKU in the EEE&CS department at HKU and advised by Kai Zhang from the Intelligent Transportation Joint Laboratory at Tsinghua University.

    My research interests encompass Computer Vision (3D), Computer Graphics (Rendering), VR/AR/MR, and Holographic Imaging/Display. I am thrilled to share my academic achievements from the year 2022, available on Google Scholar. Currently, my work focuses on Neural Radiance Fields (NeRFs), AI generation upon Diffusion, and 3D Gaussian representation, with the applications in VR/AR/MR.

    You can access my CV here: XX's Curriculum Vitae. For more detailed information, refer to the sidebar links, and feel free to contact me if you have any inquiries or interests.

    You can also use google scholar badge ).
